DataElement.preferredDefinition: The temperature conditions during the period of time when blood flow in an organ or tissue is constricted or obstructed.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._Blood deficiency in an organ or tissue caused by a constriction or obstruction of its blood vessels._A measure of the average kinetic energy of a system of particles. Temperature may be quantified, in the context of thermodynamics, as the potential of one system to transfer thermal energy to another system until both systems reach a state of thermal equilibrium.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredDefinition: Blood deficiency in an organ or tissue caused by a constriction or obstruction of its blood vessels.:A measure of the average kinetic energy of a system of particles. Temperature may be quantified, in the context of thermodynamics, as the potential of one system to transfer thermal energy to another system until both systems reach a state of thermal equilibrium.

Concepts.definition: Lack of blood supply to an area of the body, resulting in impairment of tissue oxygenation.

A measure of the average kinetic energy of a system of particles. Temperature may be quantified, in the context of thermodynamics, as the potential of one system to transfer thermal energy to another system until both systems reach a state of thermal equilibrium.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Nitrogen in a liquid state, having been super-cooled to about -200 degrees Celsius.

Concepts.definition: Nitrogen in a liquid state, having been super-cooled to -196 degrees Celsius.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: In or of the immediately surrounding area; relating to the immediate surroundings of something.

Concepts.definition: In or of the immediately surrounding area; relating to the immediate surroundings of something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A temperature of minus 20 celsius.: A solid form of carbon dioxide used as a refrigerant. At temperatures above -78.5 degrees C and ambient pressure, it changes directly to a gas as it absorbs heat.

Concepts.definition: A solid form of carbon dioxide used as a refrigerant. At temperatures above -78.5 degrees C and ambient pressure, it changes directly to a gas as it absorbs heat.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Water frozen in the solid state.

Concepts.definition: Water frozen in the solid state.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure during which the blood supply to an organ or tissue is interrupted and then later reestablished, while maintaining the organ at physiologic body temperature.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure during which the blood supply to an organ or tissue is interrupted and then later reestablished, while maintaining the organ at physiologic body temperature.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The act of decreasing both the temperature and blood flow to an organ or tissue for the purpose of preserving it for transplantation.

Concepts.definition: The act of decreasing both the temperature and blood flow to an organ or tissue for the purpose of preserving it for transplantation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The desired information is not available.

Concepts.definition: The desired information is not available.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.
